physical_requirements.description: A flat, stable surface such as a cutting board is required to secure the potato and ensure precision.
A sharp knife or chefâ€™s knife is essential for cutting through the potato without excessive force.
A firm grip on both the knife and the potato is necessary for control and to prevent slips or accidents.
A consistent, downward cutting motion with controlled force is required to achieve even dice.
Using a rocking motion or straight cuts to ensure even pieces of the diced potato.

sensory_requirements.description: Used to monitor the alignment of the knife, the size of the pieces, and to check the potato's position for even cuts.
Used to feel the texture of the potato's skin and flesh, ensuring the knife cuts smoothly and evenly through the material.
Feedback from the hands and arms to gauge the pressure applied during the cut and ensure accuracy in the knife's motion.
The sound of the knife cutting through the potato helps to assess whether the knife is cutting smoothly or encountering resistance.
